craterdog.primitives

Class Tag

  • java.lang.Object
    • craterdog.primitives.Tag
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Comparable<Tag>

    public final class Tag
extends Object
implements Comparable<Tag>
    This class provides a globally unique identifier that can be used to reference anything without requiring a centralized generator. The tag is "self hashing" making it very efficient as a key.
    Author:
    Derk Norton

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Tag()
      This default constructor creates an instance of a tag with a new random value.
      Tag(byte[] bytes)
      This constructor creates an instance of a tag with the specified value.
      Tag(int tagSizeInBytes)
      This constructor creates an instance of a new tag with the specified number of bytes.
      Tag(String value)
      This constructor creates an instance of a tag with the specified value.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static int calculateStringSize(int tagSize)
      This function calculates the size of the string that will be generated for a specific tag size.
      int compareTo(Tag tag)
      Returns an integer (signum) that tells whether this tag is greater than (1), less than (-1), or equal to (0) the specified tag.
      boolean equals(Object object)
      Returns true if this tag is equal to the specified tag and false otherwise.
      int hashCode()
      Returns an integer hash value of the bytes that make up this tag.

      Returns the byte array for this tag.

      Returns a human readable version of this tag.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Tag

        public Tag()
        This default constructor creates an instance of a tag with a new random value.

      • Tag

        public Tag(int tagSizeInBytes)
        This constructor creates an instance of a new tag with the specified number of bytes.
        Parameters:
        tagSizeInBytes - The number of bytes that should be used to define the new tag.

      • Tag

        public Tag(byte[] bytes)
        This constructor creates an instance of a tag with the specified value.
        Parameters:
        bytes - The initial value of the tag as a byte array.

      • Tag

        public Tag(String value)
        This constructor creates an instance of a tag with the specified value.
        Parameters:
        value - The initial value of the tag as a base 32 string.

    • Method Detail

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Returns a human readable version of this tag.
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object
        Returns:
        A string containing a modified base 32 encoding of the bytes that make up this tag.

      • toBytes

        public byte[] toBytes()
        Returns the byte array for this tag.
        Returns:
        The byte array for this tag.

      • hashCode

        public int hashCode()
        Returns an integer hash value of the bytes that make up this tag. Since the bytes are a generated crypto-random sequence, the first four bytes make a perfect hash value. No additional processing is necessary.
        Overrides:
        hashCode in class Object
        Returns:
        The integer hash value for the tag.

      • equals

        public boolean equals(Object object)
        Returns true if this tag is equal to the specified tag and false otherwise. Two tag are equal if they have exactly the same bytes.
        Overrides:
        equals in class Object
        Parameters:
        object - The tag to be compared.
        Returns:
        true if the tags are equal and false otherwise.

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo(Tag tag)
        Returns an integer (signum) that tells whether this tag is greater than (1), less than (-1), or equal to (0) the specified tag.
        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface Comparable<Tag>
        Parameters:
        tag - The tag with which to be compared.
        Returns:
        The resulting signum value.

      • calculateStringSize

        public static int calculateStringSize(int tagSize)
        This function calculates the size of the string that will be generated for a specific tag size.
        Parameters:
        tagSize - The number of bytes in the tag.
        Returns:
        The number of characters in the corresponding string representation of the tag.
